item.text: Now this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, met Abraham as he was returning from defeating the kings and blessed him.
To him also Abraham apportioned a tithe of everything. His name first means king of righteousness, then king of Salem, that is, king of peace.

<st data-num="540">Without father</st>, <st data-num="282">without mother</st>, <st data-num="35">without genealogy</st>, he <st data-num="2192" class="">has</st> <st data-num="3383" class="">neither</st> <st data-num="746" class="">beginning</st> of <st data-num="2250" class="">days</st> <st data-num="3383" class="">nor</st> <st data-num="5056" class="">end</st> of <st data-num="2222" class="">life</st> <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> is <st data-num="871" class="">like</st> the <st data-num="5207" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>, and he <st data-num="3306" class="">remains</st> a <st data-num="2409" class="">priest</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">for</st> <st data-num="1336">all time</st>.

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="2334" class="">see</st> <st data-num="4080">how great</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">he</st> must be, if<n id="1" /> <st data-num="11" class="">Abraham</st> the <st data-num="3966" class="">patriarch</st> <st data-num="1325" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="3739">him</st> a <st data-num="1182">tithe</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1537">of</st> his <st data-num="205" class="">plunder</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> <st data-num="3588">those</st> <st data-num="1537">of</st> the <st data-num="5207" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="3017" class="">Levi</st> who <st data-num="2983" class="">receive</st> the <st data-num="2405" class="">priestly office</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2192" class="">have</st> <st data-num="1785" class="">authorization</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">according to</st> the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st> to <st data-num="586">collect a tithe</st> from the <st data-num="2992" class="">people</st>, <st data-num="3778" class="">that</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st>, from <st data-num="846" class="">their</st> <st data-num="80">fellow countrymen</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="2539" class="">although</st> they, too, are <st data-num="1831 3751">descendants</st> of <st data-num="11" class="">Abraham</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> Melchizedek<n id="1" /> who does <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1075" class="">share</st> <st data-num="846" class="">their</st> <st data-num="1075" class="">ancestry</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1183" class="">collected a tithe</st><n id="3" /> from <st data-num="11" class="">Abraham</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2127" class="">blessed</st><n id="4" /> the one who <st data-num="2192" class="">possessed</st> the <st data-num="1860" class="">promise</st>.

<st data-num="1161" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="5565" class="">without</st> <st data-num="485" class="">dispute</st> the <st data-num="1640" class="">inferior</st> is <st data-num="2127" class="">blessed</st> <st data-num="5259" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="2909" class="">superior</st>,

<st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5602 3303">in one case</st> <st data-num="1182">tithes</st> are <st data-num="2983" class="">received</st> by <st data-num="599" class="">mortal</st> <st data-num="444" class="">men</st>, <st data-num="1161">while</st> in the <st data-num="1563" class="">other</st> by him who is <st data-num="3140" class="">affirmed</st> to be <st data-num="2198" class="">alive</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> it <st data-num="5613">could</st> be <st data-num="3004">said</st> that <st data-num="3017" class="">Levi</st> himself, who <st data-num="2983" class="">receives</st> <st data-num="1181" class="">tithes</st>, <st data-num="1183">paid a tithe</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">through</st> <st data-num="11" class="">Abraham</st>.
For he was still in his ancestor Abraham’s loins when Melchizedek met him.

So if perfection had in fact been possible through the Levitical priesthood—for on that basis the people received the law—what further need would there have been for another priest to arise, said to be in the order of Melchizedek and not in Aaron’s order?

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> when the <st data-num="2420" class="">priesthood</st> <st data-num="3346" class="">changes</st>, a <st data-num="3331" class="">change</st> in the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st> <st data-num="1537 318">must</st> <st data-num="1096" class="">come</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">as well</st>.

<st data-num="1063" class="">Yet</st> the <st data-num="3739" class="">one</st> <st data-num="3778">these things</st> are <st data-num="3004">spoken about</st> <st data-num="3348" class="">belongs</st> to<n id="1" /> a <st data-num="2087" class="">different</st> <st data-num="5443">tribe</st>, and <st data-num="3762">no one</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="3739">that tribe</st><n id="2" /> has ever <st data-num="4337" class="">officiated</st> at the <st data-num="2379" class="">altar</st>.

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> it is <st data-num="4271" class="">clear</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">that</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">our</st> <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st> is <st data-num="393" class="">descended</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">from</st> <st data-num="2455">Judah</st>, yet <st data-num="3475" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="2980" class="">said</st> <st data-num="3762" class="">nothing</st> <st data-num="4012" class="">about</st> <st data-num="2409" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">in</st> connection with <st data-num="3739" class="">that</st> <st data-num="5443" class="">tribe</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> this <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="2089" class="">even</st> <st data-num="4053 2612">clearer</st> <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> <st data-num="2087" class="">another</st> <st data-num="2409" class="">priest</st> <st data-num="450" class="">arises</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="3665" class="">likeness</st> of <st data-num="3198" class="">Melchizedek</st>,

<st data-num="3739" class="">who</st> has <st data-num="1096" class="">become</st> a priest <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">by</st> a <st data-num="3551" class="">legal</st> <st data-num="1785" class="">regulation</st> about <st data-num="4560">physical descent</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="1411" class="">power</st> of an <st data-num="179" class="">indestructible</st> <st data-num="2222" class="">life</st>.
For here is the testimony about him: “You are a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek.”

<st data-num="3303">On the one hand</st> a <st data-num="4254" class="">former</st> <st data-num="1785" class="">command</st> <st data-num="1096" class="">is</st> <st data-num="115">set aside</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1223" class="">because</st> <st data-num="846" class="">it</st> is <st data-num="772" class="">weak</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="512" class="">useless</st>,<n id="2" />

<st data-num="1063" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st> <st data-num="5048" class="">made</st> <st data-num="3762" class="">nothing</st> <st data-num="5048" class="">perfect</st>. <st data-num="1161">On the other hand</st> a <st data-num="2909" class="">better</st> <st data-num="1680" class="">hope</st> is <st data-num="1898" class="">introduced</st>, <st data-num="1223" class="">through</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">which</st> we <st data-num="1448">draw near</st> to <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> <st data-num="2596 3745">since</st><n id="1" /> this was <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> done <st data-num="5565" class="">without</st> a <st data-num="3728" class="">sworn affirmation</st>—<st data-num="1063" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="3588">others</st> have <st data-num="1096" class="">become</st> <st data-num="2409" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="5565" class="">without</st> a <st data-num="3728" class="">sworn affirmation</st>,
but Jesus did so with a sworn affirmation by the one who said to him, “The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind, ‘You are a priest forever’”—

<st data-num="2596 5118">accordingly</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> has <st data-num="1096" class="">become</st> the <st data-num="1450" class="">guarantee</st><n id="1" /> of a <st data-num="2909" class="">better</st> <st data-num="1242" class="">covenant</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> the <st data-num="3588 3303">others</st><n id="1" /> who <st data-num="1096" class="">became</st> <st data-num="2409" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> <st data-num="4183">numerous</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">because</st> <st data-num="2288" class="">death</st> <st data-num="2967" class="">prevented</st> them<n id="2" /> from <st data-num="3887" class="">continuing</st> in office,<n id="3" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> he <st data-num="2192" class="">holds</st> his <st data-num="2420" class="">priesthood</st> <st data-num="531" class="">permanently</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">since</st> <st data-num="846" class="">he</st> <st data-num="3306" class="">lives</st> <st data-num="1519 165">forever</st>.

<st data-num="3606" class="">So</st> he is <st data-num="1410" class="">able</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> <st data-num="4982" class="">save</st> <st data-num="3838" class="">completely</st> those who <st data-num="4334" class="">come</st> to <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">through</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> because he <st data-num="3842" class="">always</st> <st data-num="2198" class="">lives</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> <st data-num="1793" class="">intercede</st> <st data-num="5228" class="">for</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>.

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> it is <st data-num="2532" class="">indeed</st> <st data-num="4241" class="">fitting</st> for <st data-num="1473" class="">us</st> to have <st data-num="5108" class="">such</st> a <st data-num="749">high priest</st>: <st data-num="3741" class="">holy</st>, <st data-num="172" class="">innocent</st>, <st data-num="283" class="">undefiled</st>, <st data-num="5563" class="">separate</st> <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="268" class="">sinners</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1096" class="">exalted</st> <st data-num="5308" class="">above</st> the <st data-num="3772" class="">heavens</st>.

<st data-num="3739">He</st> <st data-num="2192" class="">has</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">no</st> <st data-num="318" class="">need</st> to do <st data-num="2596" class="">every</st> <st data-num="2250" class="">day</st> what those <st data-num="749" class="">priests</st> do, to <st data-num="399" class="">offer</st> <st data-num="2378" class="">sacrifices</st> <st data-num="4387" class="">first</st> <st data-num="5228" class="">for</st> <st data-num="2398" class="">their own</st> <st data-num="266" class="">sins</st> and <st data-num="1899" class="">then</st> for the sins of the <st data-num="2992" class="">people</st>, <st data-num="1063" class="">since</st> he <st data-num="4160" class="">did</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> in <st data-num="399" class="">offering</st> <st data-num="1438" class="">himself</st> <st data-num="2178">once for all</st>.
For the law appoints as high priests men subject to weakness, but the word of solemn affirmation that came after the law appoints a son made perfect forever.
